Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Self-centered \Self`-cen"tered\, Self-centred \Self`-cen"tred\, a. 1. Centered in itself, or in one's self. [1913 Webster]
There hangs the ball of earth and water mixt, Self-centered and unmoved. --Dryden. [1913 Webster]
2. interested solely or primiarily in oneself, or one's own welfare; disinclined to consider the interests of others; selfish; egotistical. [PJC]
self-centered adj : limited to or caring only about yourself and your own needs [syn: {egocentric}, {egoistical}, {self-centred}]
